text: Don Juan DeMarco is a 1995 movie starring Johnny Depp. It was released to theaters by Warner Bros. == Plot == John Arnold DeMarco (Johnny Depp) believes himself to be Don Juan, the greatest lover in the world. Clad in a cape and eye-mask, he undergoes psychiatric treatment with Marlon Brando's character to cure him of his apparent disillusionment with his identity. But the psychiatric sessions have an unexpected effect on his psychiatrist, whose relationship with his wife, played by Faye Dunaway, is also affected. == Music == Selena made a brief cameo appearance as a Mariachi singer. A hit single for Bryan Adams, "Have You Ever Really Loved a Woman?", is the cornerstone of the soundtrack. ==Cast== * Johnny Depp as John Arnold DeMarco/Don Juan * Marlon Brando as Dr. Jack Mickler * Faye Dunaway as Marilyn Mickler * Géraldine Pailhas as Doña Ana * Franc Luz as Don Antonio * Bob Dishy as Dr. Paul Showalter * Rachel Ticotin as Doña Inez * Talisa Soto as Doña Julia * 'Tiny' Lister, Jr. as Rocco Compton * Richard C. Sarafin as Detective Sy Tobias * Tresa Hughes as Grandma DeMarco * Stephen Singer as Dr. Bill Dunmore * Selena as Mariachi singer == Other websites == * * * * * Movie stills * Roger Ebert Review Category:1995 comedy movies Category:1995 drama movies Category:1995 romance movies Category:English-language movies
title: Don Juan DeMarco
